ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Kurn's Tower was  LAMENT and undead?
ygData.msgSnippet: It wasn t at all crowded. When we went in there was one lower level druid soloing the skeletons (to let you know how blue they were) We grouped with him and
ygData.messageBody:
It wasn't at all crowded. When we went in there was one lower
level druid soloing the skeletons (to let you know how blue they were)
We grouped with him and helped him have less downtime. OTOH,
there are more Iskar in that level range now. That was within a week/
week and a half of Kunark coming out. Kurn's Tower (at least the
skeleton portion) would, IMHO, be good for a group of around lvl 15.
If you're a little higher, go down to the badgers. They are an interesting
challenge
and at least have the potential of going higher in level.

WArning: the badgers do have a lifetap that seems impossible to stun.
You're going to need a enchanter or someone to remove them from
battle entirely (other than the one you are fighting)

The druid we grouped with said there IS a named skeleton that spawns in the
throne
room Not named in the classical sense. But in that he was a rarer spawn that
occasionally dropped a nice (tunic? I think) item. There are also some named
that
drop quest loot of some sort. (This mostly useful for Iskar though, as the
quests are mostly Iskar, as I'm finding out in my Warrior) In another
few levels I'll be taking Jidranth over to Kurn's Tower and seeing what he
thinks of the place at a more level appropriate time.

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
>Sent: Friday, May 26, 2000 8:25 AM
>Excellent info, thanks. One of our lower levels is a druid so he will
>probably be interested as he's wearing leather right now I think. Most of
>the people who might be interested aren't really twinked, but they might
>have an item or two from higher level guildmembers. If we do it I'll be
>more of a bopdyguard and observer than actually looking for loot myself
>other than a recipe for that darned cake. Was it very crowded?
>
> Kit
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
>Sent: Friday, May 26, 2000 9:27 AM
>To: eqbards@egroups.com
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Kurn's Tower was LAMENT and undead?
>
>
>Lots of quest loot, lots of bones. Money.
>We didn't find anything oh-aw spiffy.
>
>OTOH, all three of those of us in there were item-twinked.
>There was one magical item (BUrnyai Hide Sleeves) we got
>off a greenie skeleton. Our monk could wear it, but
>decided not to. i believe Druids could wear it too, so
>bards probably could.
>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
>>Sent: Friday, May 26, 2000 8:10 AM
>
>>Anyone know if there is any interesting loot in Kurn's tower? I was
>>thinking it might be a good place to look for Burynai Bundt Cake.
>>Also some
>>of my guilds lower level member were thinking of trying it.
>>
>> Kit
>
>
